term_definitions.items: Дополнительная контекстная информация для хранения в Context_details
Полученная информация о физическом или ментальном нарушения у пациента.
*Symptom name should be coded with a terminology, where possible.(en)
*The name of the reported symptom or sign.(en)
*Narrative description about the reported symptom or sign.(en)
*For example: pain could be described as constant or intermittent.(en)
*Narrative description about the pattern of the symptom or sign during this episode.(en)
*Perceived effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.(en)
*Detail about how a specific factor effects the identified symptom or sign during this episode.(en)
*Examples of modifying factor: lying on multiple pillows, eating or administration of a specific medication.(en)

*Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.(en)
*Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.(en)
*The intensity of the symptom or sign does not cause interference with normal activity.(en)
*The intensity of the symptom or sign causes interference with normal activity.(en)
*The intensity of the symptom or sign causes prevents normal activity.(en)

*Symptom severity can be rated by the individual by recording a score from 0 (ie symptom not present) to 10.0 (ie symptom is as severe as the individual can imagine). This score can be represented in the user interface as a visual analogue scale. The data element has occurrences set to 0..* to allow for variations such as 'maximal severity' or 'average severity' to be included in a template.(en)
*Numerical rating scale representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.(en)
*If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.(en)
*The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.(en)
*The number of times this symptom or sign has previously occurred.(en)

*Record as True if the subject of care has reported the symptom as not significant. For example: if the individual has never experienced the symptom it is appropriate to record 'nil significant'; or if the individual commonly experiences the symptom, in some circumstances it may be considered appropriate to record 'nil significant' if the individual has experienced no deviation from their 'normal' baseline.(en)
*The identified symptom or sign was reported as not being present to any significant degree.(en)
*For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.(en)
*Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.(en)
*Narrative description of the effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.(en)
*For example: frequency/periodicity - per hour, day, week, month, year; and regularity. May include a comparison to this episode.(en)
*Narrative description of any or all previous episodes.(en)

*In linked clinical systems, it is possible that associated symptoms or signs are already recorded within the EHR. Systems can allow the clinician to LINK to relevant associated symptoms/signs. However in a system or message without LINKs to existing data or with a new patient, additional instances of the symptom archetype could be included here to represent associated symptoms/signs.(en)
*Structured details about any associated symptoms or signs that are concurrent.(en)

*In linked clinical systems, it is possible that previous episodes are already recorded within the EHR. Systems can allow the clinician to LINK to relevant previous episodes. However in a system or message without LINKs to existing data or with a new patient, additional instances of the symptom archetype could be included here to represent previous episodes. It is recommended that new instances of the Symptom archetype inserted in this SLOT represent one or many previous episodes to this Symptom instance only.(en)
*Structured details of the symptom or sign during a previous episode.(en)

*If the anatomical location is included in the Symptom name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant. If the anatomical location is recorded using the 'Body site' data element, then use of CLUSTER archetypes in this SLOT is not allowed - record only the simple 'Body site' OR 'Structured body site', but not both.(en)
*Structured body site where the symptom or sign was reported.(en)

*Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple body sites to be separated out in a template if desired. This allows for representation of clinical scenarios where a symptom or sign needs to be recorded in multiple locations or identifying both the originating and distal site in pain radiation, but where all of the other attributes such as impact and duration are identical. If the requirements for recording the body site are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the Detailed anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the Symptom name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. If the anatomical location is recorded using the 'Structured body site' SLOT, then use of this data element is not allowed - record only the simple 'Body site' OR 'Structured body site', but not both.(en)
*Simple body site where the symptom or sign was reported.(en)

*While partial dates are permitted, the exact date and time of onset can be recorded, if appropriate. If this symptom or sign is experienced for the first time or is a re-occurrence, this date is used to represent the onset of this episode. If this symptom or sign is ongoing, this data element may be redundant if it has been recorded previously.(en)
*The onset for this episode of the symptom or sign.(en)
*Specific data elements that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of the identified symptom or sign.(en)
*Structured detail about the factor associated with the identified symptom or sign.(en)

*Assessment of impact could consider the severity, duration and frequency of the symptom as well as the type of impact including, but not limited to, functional, social and emotional impact. Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple types of impact to be separated out in a template if desired. Examples for functional impact from hearing loss may include: 'Difficulty Hearing in Quiet Environment'; 'Difficulty Hearing the TV or Radio'; 'Difficulty Hearing Group Conversation'; and 'Difficulty Hearing on Phone'.(en)
*Description of the impact of this symptom or sign.(en)
*The factor has no impact on the symptom or sign.(en)
*The factor increases the severity or impact of the symptom or sign.(en)
*The factor decreases the severity or impact of the symptom or sign, but does not fully resolve it.(en)

*If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Duration' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, considered redundant. While partial dates are permitted, the exact date and time of resolution can be recorded, if appropriate.(en)
*The timing of the cessation of this episode of the symptom or sign.(en)
*Additional narrative about the symptom or sign not captured in other fields.(en)
*The type of the onset can be coded with a terminology, if desired. For example: gradual; or sudden.(en)
*Description of the onset of the symptom or sign.(en)
*For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.(en)
*Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.(en)
*Identification of factors or events that trigger the onset or commencement of the symptom or sign.(en)
*Identification of factors or events that trigger resolution or cessation of the symptom or sign.(en)
*For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.(en)
*Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.(en)
*The interval of time between the occurrence or onset of the factor and onset/resolution of the symptom or sign.(en)
*Category of this episode for the identified symptom or sign.(en)
*A new episode of the symptom or sign - either the first ever occurrence or a reoccurrence where the previous episode had completely resolved.(en)
*It is not possible to determine if this occurrence of the symptom or sign is new or ongoing.(en)
*This symptom or sign is ongoing, effectively a single, continuous episode.(en)
*Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple types of progression to be separated out in a template if desired - for example, severity or frequency.(en)
*Description progression of the symptom or sign at the time of reporting.(en)
*The severity of the symptom or sign has improved overall during this episode.(en)
*The severity of the symptom or sign has not changed overall during this episode.(en)
*The severity of the symptom or sign has worsened overall during this episode.(en)
*The severity of the symptom or sign has resolved.(en)
*Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.(en)
*Record as True if this is the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign.(en)
*Is this the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign?(en)

*In linked clinical systems, it is possible that previous episodes are already recorded within the EHR. Systems can allow the clinician to LINK to relevant previous episodes. It is recommended that new instances of the Symptom archetype inserted in this SLOT represent one or many previous episodes to this Symptom instance only.(en)

*If the anatomical location is included in the Symptom name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant. If the anatomical location is recorded using the 'Body site' data element, then use of CLUSTER archetypes in this SLOT is not allowed - record only the simple 'Body site' OR 'Structured body site', but not both.(en)

*Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple body sites to be separated out in a template if desired. This allows for representation of clinical scenarios where a symptom or sign needs to be recorded in multiple locations or identifying both the originating and distal site in pain radiation, but where all of the other attributes such as impact and duration are identical. If the requirements for recording the body site are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the Detailed anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. *Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.(en)

вызывается недостаточным количеством кислорода в легких и нарушением его поступления в кровь, другие ткани и органы
вызывается невозможностью присоединения кислорода к гемоглобину и приводит к ишемии клеток головного мозга
вызывается нарушением поглощения кислорода клетками тканей
проявляется по поверхности всего тела, вызывается при нарушении дыхательной функции или при общем нарушении кровообращения

выявляется при осмотре носоглотки, зева или половых органов и вызывается застоем крови

цианоз на лице наблюдается постоянно, периодически может возникать на периферии (руки, грудная клетка)

*For example, entire body, face or right cheek. If the body site has previously been identified in another archetype in which this archetype is nested, this data element becomes redundant.(en)
*Identification of the area of skin under examination.(en)

*Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element. If 'No abnormality detected' is selected, then recording of other examination data elements becomes redundant, with the exception of only the 'Clinical interpretation' data element, which may be useful if a normal statement is desired for recording, for example 'Normal skin examination'.(en)
*Statement that no abnormality was detected (NAD) on physical examination.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the skin examination.(en)

*For example, allowing fractal examination of a more specific area of the skin site. It could also be used to record the examination of a specific lesion or wound, for example by using the 'Alias' data element in CLUSTER.exam_burn or CLUSTER.exam_lesion.(en)
*Structured details about one or more specific findings on physical examination of the identified skin site.(en)
*Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.(en)
*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.(en)
*Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.(en)
*If the body site has previously been identified in another archetype in which this archetype is then nested, this SLOT becomes redundant.(en)
*A structured description of the area of skin under examination.(en)

*Use this cluster of data elements where it makes sense to record summary information only. For example: the presence/absence of the identified finding (such as psoriasis), or the number of items (such as number of condyloma present).(en)
*Summary information about findings on the skin at the identified body site.(en)
*'Finding' should be coded with a terminology, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the clinical finding, by name or category.(en)
*The presence or absence of the specified finding.(en)
*The number of the specified finding observed in the identified body site.(en)
*The finding is observed to be present.(en)
*The finding is not observed to be present.(en)
*It is not able to be determined if the finding is present or absent..(en)
*Findings observed during the physical examination of a subject of care.(en)
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.(en)

*May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination or key aspects of clinical examination findings, which will be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a patient.(en)

*Detailed clinical findings will be recorded as CLUSTER archetypes which can be nested within this SLOT to represent the fractal nature of clinical examination and allow for variation in clinician's requirements for examination documentation. For example: CLUSTER.palpation_of_uterus, CLUSTER.palpation_of_cervix and CLUSTER.palpation_of_fetus can be nested in this slot or within each other to represent the specific requirements of clinicians working in the obstetric domains - content, priorities and level of detail will differ depending on clinical context, professional background and specialty.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, 'normal examination' or 'tympanic membrane perforation'.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.(en)
*Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the physical examination findings.(en)
*Details about any device used during the physical examination.(en)
*Additional narrative about the overall physical examination findings not captured in other fields.(en)
*e.g. Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*The body position of the subject during the examination.(en)

Особые патологические дыхательные паттеры. Те паттерны, которые не были охвачены в списке, Пользователю можно перечислить в текстовом поле. Иначе недостающие паттерны можно определить на уровне template.
*Deep chest breathing with or without a visible gasp.(en)
*Periods of hyperventilation alternating with periods of apnoea.(en)
*Breathing of varying tidal volumes and rates.(en)
*Deep, gasping inspiration with a pause at full inspiration followed by a brief, insufficient release of breath.(en)
*Clusters of irregular breaths that alternate with periods of apnoea. Also termed Biot's breathing.(en)

*Subject's level of exertion at or just prior to the observation being made. Intended only to record exertion only as it might effect respirations and where it would not normally be recorded as part of general clinical observation.(en)
*The respiratory expiratory phase is longer than normal/usual. Associated with obstructive airways disease such as asthma.(en)
*Details of the amount of oxygen being delivered to the subject at the time of observation. Assumed values of 21% oxygen concentration, Fi02 of 0.21 and oxygen flow rate of 0 l/min or 0 ml/min.(en)
*Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the respirations observation. For example, level of anxiety, pain, feeding in infants, tracheostomy.(en)
Сердечный тон расщеплен по причине физиологических изменений.
Переменное расщепление не является физиологическим по природе.
Временная диаграмма расщепления является физиологической, но расщепление заметнее нормального.
Сердечный тон расщеплен по причине физиологических изменений.
Переменное расщепление не является физиологическим по природе.

Групповое описание одного или нескольких дополнительных сердечных тонов.
Специфические результаты аускультации, связанные с обследованием сердца.
Систолический щелчок при сжатии сердечной мышцы.
Слышный ритм, напоминающий конский галоп; связанзан с долполнительными сердечными тонами.
Временная диаграмма, увязанная с циклом сжатия сердечной мышцы.
Звук близок к ожидаемому уровню первого сердечного тона.
Места, где результат прослушивается, помимо места максимального звука.
Очень слабый для распознавания шума даже после выслушивания в течение некоторого времени.
Слабый, но легко распознаваемый шум после прикладывания стетоскопа к грудной клетке.
Очень сильный, но шум не слышен, если стетоскоп отведен от стенки грудной клетки.
Самый сильный шум, слышный даже если стетоскоп отведен от стенки грудной клетки.
Временная диаграмма, увязанная с циклом сжатия сердечной мышцы.

Локальное измерение артериального давления, которое является суррогатом артериального давления в системном кровотоке. Как правило, термин относится к давления плечевой артерии на предплечье.
Пик системного артериального давления - измеряется в систолиу или в фазу сокращения сердца
Минимальное системное артериальное давление - измеряется в диастолу или в фазу релаксации сердца.

Манжета для руки взрослого, увеличенного объёма - пузырь приблизительно 16cm x 38cm.
Манжета стандартная для взрослого - пузырь приблизительно 13 х 30cm.

*PLEASE NOTE: '°' is a valid UCUM unit. Please use 'deg' as the correct unit.(en)
*The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the time of measurement.(en)
Среднее артериальное давление на всём протяжении цикла сокращения и релаксации сердца.
Разница между систолическим и диастолическим давлением.
Манжета взрослая малая - пузырь приблизительно 10 x 24cm.
Манжета для детей или взрослых с тонкой рукой - пузырь примерно 8см x 21cm.
Запись звука Короткова который используют для определения диастолического давления с помощью метода аускультации.
Четвёртый звук Короткова, определяющийся как резкое приглушение звуков.
Пятый звук Короткова определяется отсутствием звуков, так как давление в манжете падает ниже диастолического артериального давления.

Лёжа на плоской поверхности с боковым наклоном, как правило, под углом по направлению с левой стороны. Обычно требуется в последнем триместре беременности, чтобы облегчить сдавление нижней полой вены.
Манжета для младенцев - пузырь приблизительно 5см x 15cm.
Манжета для новорожденных, используется в соответствии с весом новорожденного.
Информация о сфигмоманометре или другом устройстве, используемом для измерения АД.
Подробная информация о физической деятельности, осуществляемой во время измерения АД.

*Use 'Location of measurement' to select from a value set of common sites or free text choice. Use SLOT for 'Structured measurement location' to record unusual sites, such as intra-arterial catheter sites. 'Specific location' has been deprecated.(en)
Расположение на теле, где измеряется артериальное давление.
Элемент данных устарел и заменен свободным текстовым компонентом типа данных «Место измерения».
Неинвазивный метод измерения АД с использованием стетоскопа и звуков Короткова.
Неинвазивный метод измерения АД с использованием пальпации (обычно плечевой или лучевой артерии).
Формула, используемая для вычисления СрАД (если требуется записывать).
Неинвазивный метод измерения АД с помощью автоматического тонометра.
Инвазивный метод измерения АД, с помещением датчика внутри кровеносного сосуда.
Оценка среднего АД за период в 24 часа.
Стадия сна - для интерпретации записи амбулаторного измерения АД в течение 42 часов.
Пациент находится в состоянии естественного покоя, тело расслаблено.
Комментарий и записи других случайных факторов, которые могут способствовать измерению артериального давления. Например,"боязнь белого халата" или боль и жар, изменения атмосферного давления т.д.
Инвазивное измерение через линию доступа преобразователя в артерии.
Формула, используемая для расчета систолического давления из среднего артериального давления (если записана в данных).
Формула, используемая для расчета диастолического давления от среднего артериального давления (если записана в данных).
Структурированное анатомическое место, в котором проводилось измерение.
*For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
Дополнительная информация, необходимая для захвата локального контекста или согласования с другими эталонными моделями / формализмами.
Для записи данных, выявленных при обследовании методом пальпации.
Предназначен для записи результатов обследования органов брюшной полости
Описание, за счет чего увеличен живот
Клинические данные, полученные во время физикального осмотра живота.
*Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element.(en)
*Statement that no abnormality was detected (NAD) on physical examination.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.(en)
*Structured details about the physical examination findings.(en)
*Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.(en)
*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.(en)
*Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.(en)
*Findings observed during the physical examination of a subject of care.(en)
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.(en)

*May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination or key aspects of clinical examination findings, which will be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a patient.(en)

*Detailed clinical findings will be recorded as CLUSTER archetypes which can be nested within this SLOT to represent the fractal nature of clinical examination and allow for variation in clinician's requirements for examination documentation. For example: CLUSTER.palpation_of_uterus, CLUSTER.palpation_of_cervix and CLUSTER.palpation_of_fetus can be nested in this slot or within each other to represent the specific requirements of clinicians working in the obstetric domains - content, priorities and level of detail will differ depending on clinical context, professional background and specialty.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, 'normal examination' or 'tympanic membrane perforation'.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.(en)
*Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the physical examination findings.(en)
*Details about any device used during the physical examination.(en)
*Additional narrative about the overall physical examination findings not captured in other fields.(en)
*e.g. Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*The body position of the subject during the examination.(en)
Для записи данных, выявленных при обследовании методом пальпации.
Клинические данные, полученные во время физикального осмотра органов, анатомических систем и структур.

*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.(en)
*Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.(en)
*If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' or the 'Body site' data element, this SLOT becomes redundant.(en)
*A structured description of the area of the body under examination.(en)

Характеристики для заданной проблемы или диагноза.
*This data element is usually recorded as part of a clinical consultation.(en)
Категория новых, повторяющихся и текущих вопросов, проблем или диагнозов.
Категория, которая поддерживает разделение проблем и диагнозов на активные или неактивные списки проблем.

*The status is usually determined by a combination of the timing of diagnosis plus level of clinical certainty resulting from diagnostic tests and clinical evidence available. Terms are aligned with SNOMED CT.(en)
Первоначальный диагноз, обычно связанный с низким уровнем клинической достоверности. Он может измениться по мере того, как будут получены результаты тестирования или рекомендации.

Промежуточный диагноз, основанный на разумном количестве клинической достоверности, но ожидающий дальнейших результатов испытаний или клинических рекомендаций. Он может по-прежнему меняться по мере того, как результаты тестов или рекомендации становятся доступными.
Окончательный обоснованный диагноз, основанный на высоком уровне клинической определенности, который включает клинические данные и результаты обследований. Ожидается, что он не изменится.
Проблема или диагноз в настоящее время активны и клинически значимы.
Проблема или диагноз не полностью определены, неактивны или менее уместны к текущему клиническому случаю.
Новое возникновение новой или существующей проблемы или диагноза. Отметку «Впервые возникший» можно записать отдельно, чтобы отличить первое от других случаев.
Клиническая ситуация, проблема или диагноз существуют продолжительно, без появления новых эпизодов.
Категория, которая поддерживает разделение проблем и диагнозов на текущие или прошедшие списки проблем.
Вопрос, который возник в настоящее время.

В контекстах эпизодической помощи (обычно вторичной помощи), включает классификацию / организацию проблемы в соответствии с ее отношением к основному вопросу или диагнозу, которые рассматриваются во время нынешнего оказания помощи. Эти категории могут также использоваться для клинического кодирования, отчетности и выставления счетов.
Установленный диагноз, согласно которому осуществлялась общепринятая помощь для пациента, помощь в домашних условиях или посещения учреждения здравоохранения.
Проблема или диагноз, который возникает одновременно с основной проблемой или диагнозом. Может также быть оформлен как сопутствующее заболевание.
Невозможно определить, является ли это возникновение проблемы или диагноза новым или продолжающимся.

*Record as True if this is the first ever occurrence of this problem or diagnosis. This data element can be an additional qualifier on the 'New episode' value in the 'Episodicity' value set, that is a condition such as asthma can have recurring new episodes that have periods of resolution in between. However it can be important to identify the first every episode of asthma from all of the other episodes.(en)
Первое появление этой проблемы или диагноза?

*Record as True if the problem or diagnosis was present on admission. This data element enables identification of complications or secondary diagnoses that commenced during a specified admission for DRG reporting purposes.(en)
Была ли проблема или диагноз основной при поступлении?
Характеристика или эволюция проблемы или диагноза.
Повторяющаяся проблема или диагноз, с периодами разрешения между эпизодами или случаями.
Проблема или диагноз с постоянным или долговременным течением или которые медленно эволюционируют с течением времени.
Проблема или диагноз с быстрым началом или течением или и тем, и другим.

*For example: The boolean data type could be used to signify that the problem/diagnosis can be included in a patient summary; the text data type could be used to categorise in a similar way to 'Current?' or Active?'; and the count data type could be used to assert a priority key or order to problems and diagnoses in a list. If any uses are identified as frequently required, they could be added explicitly to this archetype as an explicit data element.(en)
Неопределенный показатель-классификатор, который должен будет преименовать, перезадать потенциальные значения, определенные в шаблоне
Статус разрешения или исцеления острой проблемы или диагноза.
Проблема или диагностика завершили заданные этапы восстановления или исцеления и могут считаться разрешенными.
Проблема или диагноз прогрессирующие удовлетворительно посредством нормальных этапов восстановления или исцеления в направлении разрешения.
Проблема или диагноз не проходят удовлетворительно после нормальных этапов восстановления или исцеления в сторону разрешения.
Невозможно определить процесс разрешение или состояние исцеления проблемы или диагноза.
Диагноз был подвергнут клинической переоценке или был опровергнут с высокой клинической определенностью.

*Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)
*Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
*Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.(en)

*If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.(en)
*An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
(en)
*Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth. (en)
*Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.(en)

*Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.
If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.
(en)
*A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.(en)
*Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.(en)
*Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.(en)
*Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.(en)
*The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.(en)
*The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.(en)
*Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.(en)
Характеристики для заданной проблемы или диагноза.
*This data element is usually recorded as part of a clinical consultation.(en)
Категория новых, повторяющихся и текущих вопросов, проблем или диагнозов.
Категория, которая поддерживает разделение проблем и диагнозов на активные или неактивные списки проблем.

*The status is usually determined by a combination of the timing of diagnosis plus level of clinical certainty resulting from diagnostic tests and clinical evidence available. Terms are aligned with SNOMED CT.(en)
Первоначальный диагноз, обычно связанный с низким уровнем клинической достоверности. Он может измениться по мере того, как будут получены результаты тестирования или рекомендации.

Промежуточный диагноз, основанный на разумном количестве клинической достоверности, но ожидающий дальнейших результатов испытаний или клинических рекомендаций. Он может по-прежнему меняться по мере того, как результаты тестов или рекомендации становятся доступными.
Окончательный обоснованный диагноз, основанный на высоком уровне клинической определенности, который включает клинические данные и результаты обследований. Ожидается, что он не изменится.
Проблема или диагноз в настоящее время активны и клинически значимы.
Проблема или диагноз не полностью определены, неактивны или менее уместны к текущему клиническому случаю.
Новое возникновение новой или существующей проблемы или диагноза. Отметку «Впервые возникший» можно записать отдельно, чтобы отличить первое от других случаев.
Клиническая ситуация, проблема или диагноз существуют продолжительно, без появления новых эпизодов.
Категория, которая поддерживает разделение проблем и диагнозов на текущие или прошедшие списки проблем.
Вопрос, который возник в настоящее время.

В контекстах эпизодической помощи (обычно вторичной помощи), включает классификацию / организацию проблемы в соответствии с ее отношением к основному вопросу или диагнозу, которые рассматриваются во время нынешнего оказания помощи. Эти категории могут также использоваться для клинического кодирования, отчетности и выставления счетов.
Установленный диагноз, согласно которому осуществлялась общепринятая помощь для пациента, помощь в домашних условиях или посещения учреждения здравоохранения.
Проблема или диагноз, который возникает одновременно с основной проблемой или диагнозом. Может также быть оформлен как сопутствующее заболевание.
Невозможно определить, является ли это возникновение проблемы или диагноза новым или продолжающимся.

*Record as True if this is the first ever occurrence of this problem or diagnosis. This data element can be an additional qualifier on the 'New episode' value in the 'Episodicity' value set, that is a condition such as asthma can have recurring new episodes that have periods of resolution in between. However it can be important to identify the first every episode of asthma from all of the other episodes.(en)
Первое появление этой проблемы или диагноза?

*Record as True if the problem or diagnosis was present on admission. This data element enables identification of complications or secondary diagnoses that commenced during a specified admission for DRG reporting purposes.(en)
Была ли проблема или диагноз основной при поступлении?
Характеристика или эволюция проблемы или диагноза.
Повторяющаяся проблема или диагноз, с периодами разрешения между эпизодами или случаями.
Проблема или диагноз с постоянным или долговременным течением или которые медленно эволюционируют с течением времени.
Проблема или диагноз с быстрым началом или течением или и тем, и другим.

*For example: The boolean data type could be used to signify that the problem/diagnosis can be included in a patient summary; the text data type could be used to categorise in a similar way to 'Current?' or Active?'; and the count data type could be used to assert a priority key or order to problems and diagnoses in a list. If any uses are identified as frequently required, they could be added explicitly to this archetype as an explicit data element.(en)
Неопределенный показатель-классификатор, который должен будет преименовать, перезадать потенциальные значения, определенные в шаблоне
Статус разрешения или исцеления острой проблемы или диагноза.
Проблема или диагностика завершили заданные этапы восстановления или исцеления и могут считаться разрешенными.
Проблема или диагноз прогрессирующие удовлетворительно посредством нормальных этапов восстановления или исцеления в направлении разрешения.
Проблема или диагноз не проходят удовлетворительно после нормальных этапов восстановления или исцеления в сторону разрешения.
Невозможно определить процесс разрешение или состояние исцеления проблемы или диагноза.
Диагноз был подвергнут клинической переоценке или был опровергнут с высокой клинической определенностью.

*Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)
*Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
*Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.(en)

*If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.(en)
*An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
*Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
(en)
*Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth. (en)
*Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.(en)

*Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.
If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.
(en)
*A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.(en)

*May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.(en)
*Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.(en)

*Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.(en)
*Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.(en)
*The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.(en)
*Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.(en)
*The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.(en)
*The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.(en)
*The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.(en)
*Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.(en)
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.(en)
Описание рекоммендаций, данных пациенту после осмотра или исследований.
Универсальный архетип для подключения существующих CLUSTER-архетипов, которые необходимо отобразить как обособленную сущность.
ограничение потребления с пищей жиров и углеводов
контролируемая малобелковая диета с достаточной калорийностью
диета, богатая кальцием и витамином D
ограничить поступление в организм йода (контрастные вещества, лекарственные препараты)
повышенный питьевой режим в вечерние часы и в жаркое время года
Универсальный архетип для подключения существующих CLUSTER-архетипов, которые необходимо отобразить как обособленную сущность.

*A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.(en)
*A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.!(en)

Услуга и все сопутствующие действия выполнены
*The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.(en)
*The planned service has been cancelled prior to commencement.(en)
*The service has been suspended without completion.(en)
*Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.(en)
*Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.(en)
*For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the service.(en)
*Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.(en)
*Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.(en)
*Narrative description about the service, as appropriate for the pathway step.(en)
*Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.(en)
*The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.(en)
*Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.(en)
*The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.(en)
*Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.(en)
*Only for use in association with the 'Service delivered' pathway step. For example: record that this is the 3rd physiotherapy appointment in a planned sequence.(en)
*The sequence of the specified clinical service.(en)
*The referral has expired before the referral episode has been completed.(en)
*Only for use in association with the 'Service scheduled' pathway step.(en)
*The date and/or time on which the service is intended to be performed.(en)
*Use to capture detailed, structured information about specified aspects of the service.(en)
*Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.(en)
Взаимодействие, обмен информацией или предоставление медицинской помощи в рамках посещения пациентом медицинского учреждения лично или с помощью удалённой связи.
